conclusion: Analyze the cycle and apply thermodynamics to find temperature at State C.
The image shows a thermodynamic cycle ABCDA on a p-V diagram with horizontal and vertical segments, labeled points A, B, C, D, and axes for pressure and volume.
The cycle involves an ideal gas of definite quality undergoing a cyclic process.
Since the process is cyclic, ΔU = 0, implying the temperature at the end of the cycle is the same as the initial temperature.
For an ideal gas, internal energy U is a function of temperature only, so ΔU = nC_V ΔT = 0.
The temperature at State C is the same as at State A, T_C = T_A = T_0.
